name: Homewood Suites by Hilton Ft. Worth-North at Fossil Creek

reviews.text: Very new property. You got a sense that it islarger than an average hotel, but doesn't feel like an apartment complex or dormitory like other hotels in its class. Instead, you feel like you're in a high-end condominium. Large rooms with plenty of thoughtful touches such as excellent beds (with fluffy pillows), baths and linens. Has an audio adapter on the radio. One drawback: sink/vanity area is not separate from the bed area (not too big of an issue) and not enough outlets in the bedroom area for a laptop, cellphone charger, and JBL ipod speakers. I don't care for Ft. Worth. However, if I were to come back I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Bright Spot in a Bad Trip

reviews.text: We have 2 young children, & have stayed at Homewood Suites before (in downtown Chicago). We had a great experience then, so when we came to Texas to search for houses, we booked at Homewood again.
reviews.title: Great service & amenities, but could improve buffet
excellent!!!!
reviews.text: Having stayed @ many hotels in general, here's what we thought were the pros & cons of this place:
